body:
I was taking a look around the all time LeaderBoard around the rankings that I am. I noticed that a player that was one rank ahead of me had stats that were, let's say "Less desirable than mine". I was wondering how the LeaderBoards actually work.

However let me stop those of you about to say "LeaderBoard ranks don't mean anything", I know this already I just like competition and would like a legitimate answer from someone who would actually like to help me.

Thank you in advance!
body_tagged:

title: How does the LeaderBoard work?

replies.body: its supposed to be accurate, but it hasn't updated for a week, some bug.
replies.body_tagged: its supposed to be accurate, but it hasn't updated for a week, some bug.

replies.body: I for one don't understand how this helps me... Anyone else?
replies.body_tagged: I for one don't understand how this helps me... Anyone else?

replies.body: Sorry Roman! This wasn't directed towards you! I'm using the mobile version, I guess something glitched out. Sorry again xD
replies.body_tagged: Sorry Roman! This wasn't directed towards you! I'm using the mobile version, I guess something glitched out. Sorry again xD

replies.body: I think the Leaderboards are based off the total xp you have in all games. So if you have 1st prestige in Nebula and Nexus, that would be the same as 2nd prestige in Nebula or something.
replies.body_tagged: I think the Leaderboards are based off the total xp you have in all games. So if you have 1st prestige in Nebula and Nexus, that would be the same as 2nd prestige in Nebula or something.

replies.body:
There's a leaderboard for EXP (default,) kills, KD, etc.
But yeah, it's bugged right now and it doesn't seem to be updating.
